fields.description:
h3. Summary
If there's a Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) solution in front of Confluence, the mobile app won't be able to reach Confluence and will fail to work.

h3. Expected Results
The app opens the third-party login window as a frame, for example, and allows the user to perform this third-party authentication before moving towards the Confluence authentication.

h3. Actual Results
The following error shows in the app screen:
{quote}
Can't connect to your site

This could be because you need to use a VPN, the URL is wrong, or Confluence is unavailable.
{quote}
fields.summary: Support for Multi-Factor Authentication

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Task macro checkbox disappears when added alone without any text attached to it.  

h3. Environment

IE11 and Microsoft Edge latest versions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a checkbox using the shortcut "[ ]"
# Remove the automatic text which follows after the checkbox
# Save the page 

h3. Expected Results

The checkbox is saved normally on the page.

h3. Actual Results

The checkbox disappears.

h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

No workaround is known at this point, however in local tests this issue was not present in Edge version 42.17134.1.0
fields.summary: Task macro checkbox disappears when added alone after page save in Edge and IE11

fields.description:
Currently, there is no ability to disable the auto-update check for the Companion app installer. This pertains to the .exe for Windows OS and the .dmg for Mac. This is not an issue for the MSI, which does not get updates automatically. 

Some customers would like to have the control over this by having the possibility to disable or configure the frequency of checks for the auto-update.
fields.summary: Add the possibility to disable auto-update check for Companion App

fields.description:
h4. Problem statement
[Confluence Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/keyboard-shortcuts-markdown-and-autocomplete-724764956.html] has a more extensive list of shortcuts available in the site. 

For example, there is a keyboard shortcut to clear all formatting in a text using "Ctrl + \".

h4. Suggestion
Make the same keyboard shortcut to clear all text formatting available in Confluence Server as well.
fields.summary: Add keyboard shortcut to clear all formatting

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* When creating a custom field in Jira of the *Project Picker (single project)* type and adding a Jira Issue macro with this field to display, a non-clickable number is shown in the column instead of the linked project. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create a custom field in a Jira project of the type *Project Picker (single project)*
# Create issues in Jira with this field
# In Confluence, create a page and add the Jira Issue macro
#* Remember to add the custom field to be displayed by selecting *Display options >> Columns to display* and typing in the name of the custom field created.
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results  

* The Jira Issue macro will display the custom field column with a clickable link to a Jira Project

h3. Actual Results 

* The Jira Issue macro shows a non-clickable number in the custom field column, where the number displayed is the project's id number

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Custom Field with type Project Picker (single project) showing non-clickable number in JIM

fields.description:
As a Confluence administrator, I would like that the left side navigation to admin functions, at [Base URL]/admin, is shorter and divided into sub sections.

Every time I do global administrative tasks in Confluence, I need to spend time to find where the desired function is located in the long list. The more apps there are installed, the longer the list will be and thus the time to find the function will be longer.

Something similar to what Jira provides would be a great improvement.
fields.summary: Navigation in administration section too long

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you save a page with an unknown macro that previously had body content, the content will be lost. 
h3. Environment
 * Collaborative Editing On

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page with a parent macro A
 # Add some content to macro A
 # Save the page
 # Disable macro A
 # Edit the page (can still see macro A and its content)
 # Save the page again
 # Enable macro A again

h3. Expected Results

Once macro A is re-enabled, we can see its original content again. 
h3. Actual Results

All of the content of macro A is lost. 
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Unknown macro body is discarded with Collaborative Editing on

fields.description:
When we restart collaborative editing, duplicated content appears within the page.
h3. Steps
 # Create a page with some text and save.
 # Disable collaborative editing.
 # Enable collaborative editing.
 # Edit the saved page again. 

*What happened...*

All the content in the page is duplicated.

*What should have happened...*

The page should have retained its original state and shouldn't have duplicated.
fields.summary: Duplicated content in pages after disabling and enabling CE

fields.description:
If a big number of Confluence pages have been generated in a short period of time, it can also create a bunch of unread notifications sitting in the DB. When the system tries to fetch those notifications for a user, it doesn't apply any pagination and can fail with OOM. This has been reproduced during load testing scenario (with 100K notifications in AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION table).

The problematic method is AONotificationDao#findAllUnread in myworkday plugin. Solution to the problem is to apply pagination to workday plugin in Confluence.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Having big number of unread notifications for a user can cause OOM

fields.description:
For com.atlassian.confluence.user.actions.ProfilePictureInfo [getDownloadPath|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/6.6.0/com/atlassian/confluence/user/actions/ProfilePictureInfo.html#getDownloadPath--]() is deprecated and {{[getUriReference|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/6.6.0/com/atlassian/confluence/user/actions/ProfilePictureInfo.html#getUriReference--]()}} should be used.

{{[getUriReference|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/6.6.0/com/atlassian/confluence/user/actions/ProfilePictureInfo.html#getUriReference--]()}}  includes the context path, ie. '/confluence'.

In com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.SpaceLogo there is no deprecation of [getDownloadPath|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/6.6.0/com/atlassian/confluence/user/actions/ProfilePictureInfo.html#getDownloadPath--]() which does not include the context path (there is no {{[getUriReference|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/6.6.0/com/atlassian/confluence/user/actions/ProfilePictureInfo.html#getUriReference--]()}} in this class).

For Javascript templating I would love to have a consistent way to get image paths, either with or without context path (as I would prefix with AJS.params.contextPath in the latter case).
fields.summary: Inconsistency SDK API 6.6.0: getDownloadPath() vs. getUriReference() in ProfilePictureInfo  and SpaceLogo

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When security vulnerabilities occur, Atlassian sends emails to the primary technical contacts associated with a license. Emails can be lost in email filters or spam boxes, which can leave administrators unaware of a vulnerability. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an in-app notification to Confluence administrators to make them aware of any vulnerabilities (in addition to sending emails). 

h3. Why this is important
 It is important that administrators be informed of vulnerabilities as soon as possible. By adding this feature, we will provide an additional channel through which an administrator can learn about vulnerabilities.
fields.summary: Send in-app notifications for security vulnerabilities

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When asking a question through the 'Ask a question' button from the Questions List macro, the resulting question is not formatted properly and loses the original line breaks

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Questions List macro to a Confluence page, with the 'Ask a question' button enabled
 # Select the 'Ask a question' button to open the questions form
 # Input some text in different lines, separated by single line breaks
 # Publish the question 

h3. Expected Results
The question will be published as written, with the original formatting

h3. Actual Results
All the text from different lines is combined onto a single line, losing all line breaks

h3. Workaround
Asking a question through the 'Ask question' form on the Confluence Questions home page instead preserves the formatting as written
fields.summary: 'Ask a question' form from the Questions List macro does not preserve the original formatting
Unable to manage apps appropriately after migrating from Atlassian Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
SpaceManager.getAllSpaces(SpacesQuery) causes ORA-01795 error if the {{spaceKeys}} contain more than 1000 entries.

h3. Environment
* Oracle 11g

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Calling the following where 'spaceKeys' contain > 1000 entries will cause the issue on an instance running Oracle 11g for example. 
{code}
SpacesQuery query = SpacesQuery.newQuery().withSpaceType(SpaceType.GLOBAL)
      .forUser(user).withSpaceKeys(spaceKeys).build();

spaceManager.getAllSpaces(query); // <- Causes error
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The spaceQuery splits the SQL so as to not overflow the maximum allowed entries - I get a list of spaces as result without an error.

h3. Actual Results
Causes {{ORA-01795}} database error since Oracle doesn't support more than 1000 entries in a SQL query.

h3. Notes
* Error in question as defined by Oracle Docs: https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B10501_01/server.920/a96525/e1500.htm#1001274
* Similar confluence tickets with the same errors found:
** https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43504
** https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-44260
** https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22985 (fixed)
** https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-42654

h3. Workaround
Programmatically split the query in partitions to avoid going over the enforced maximum entries by Oracle.
fields.summary: SpaceManager.getAllSpaces(SpacesQuery) causes ORA-01795 error

fields.description:
h3. Summary If you copy a formatted text from the terminal or a text editor to a Confluence page using Firefox, it will lose its formatting. h3. Environment * Firefox h3. Steps to Reproduce # Have a formatted text, for example: {code} Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod. tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Mi tempus imperdiet nulla malesuada pellentesque elit. Sit amet tellus cras adipiscing enim eu. Sapien nec sagittis aliquam malesuada bibendum. Augue interdum velit euismod in pellentesque. Euismod in pellentesque. {code} # Edit a Confluence page # Add the text into the editor h3. Expected Results * Confluence will respect the spacing and formatting h3. Actual Results * Confluence adds a *

* tag and, therefore, an extra spacing is seen in the page. The text will look like the screenshot below: !Screen Shot 2019-04-11 at 14.49.21.png|thumbnail! h3. Workaround * Use a different browser, for example, Google Chrome * Use the *No Format macro* * Open the .txt file in any browser and copy the content from there instead of using the terminal and/or a text editor
fields.summary: Text formatting is lost when you paste it in a Confluence page using Firefox

fields.description:
It would be great If I could use Atlassian Companion with the client certificate of Web Server.

We are using nginx as a reverse proxy server. For security reason, Our Web Server is checking the verification of the client certificate with a ssl_verify_client option. 
The client certificate is working well with the web browser, but not well with Atlassian Companion App.

I attempted to edit an attached file, but the application does not start with "Companion App". It is in the image below.
I had confirmed that office application started after disabling ssl_verify_client option.
fields.summary: Using Atlassian Companion with the client certificate of Web Server.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the documentation https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/moving-from-data-center-to-server-938042866.html, section " Move items in the cluster shared home back to local home", the following description might cause the migration failure: 
{quote}
2. Move the entire config directory from your <shared home> directory to the <local home>/shared-home directory
3. Move the remaining contents of your <shared home> directory to the root of your <local home> directory
{quote} 
There is a shared confluence.cfg.xml file in the shared folder which does not contain the node level configuration as the same file in the local Confluence home, replacing it will cause Confluence failed to startup.  

h3. Suggestion
We need to change the documentation to: 
{quote}
2. Move the following directories and file from your <shared home> directory to the <local home>/shared-home directory
     * config
     * confluence.cfg.xml
     * dcl-document
     * dcl-document_hd
     * dcl-thumbnail

3. Move the remaining contents of your <shared home> directory to the root of your <local home> directory
{quote}
fields.summary: Need to update the procedure "Moving from Data Center to Server"

fields.description: As part of the fix for *this bug*. Confluence removed all special characters from search text coming from JIRA Service Desk. The wildcard search stopped working after this.
fields.summary: Wildcard Search for Confluence KB Is No Longer Working In JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* In Team Calendars, if you try to create a JQL filter showing over 700 Jira Issues, they won't load in the calendar even though the response shows as *{"success": true}*

h3. Environment 
* Jira Project with over 700 issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# In Team Calendars, select *Add Event*
## Select *Jira Issue Dates* in the *Event Type* field
## Add a name to it
## In the *Display* field, select the *JQL* option and add a filter that would return over 700 entries. In my local test instance, the filter was:
{code}
project = E84 and issuetype = Task
{code}
## Check the *Issue Created Date* check box
## Click on the *OK* button

h3. Expected Results  

* The calendar will load the issues as events in the calendar

h3. Actual Results 

* No issues are shown and, upon checking the console, we can see that the _events.json_ request will take a while to load and its response will be only *{"success": true}*

h3. Notes 

* This issue is very intermittent since I was able some times to display the required information.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Team Calendars won't load high volume of Jira Issues

fields.description:
h4. Current behaviour

When creating a new event in a Calendar it defaults to *All Day event*
 !tc_new event.png|width=373,height=433!
h4. Suggested Behaviour

Majority of events are not all day and tend to have specific times stamps, *All Day event* checkbox should be unchecked by default to allow time selection straight away, similar to the way it's designed in Ms Outlook
 !outlook.png|width=319,height=209!
fields.summary: Creating new event in a Calendar should not default to All Day event

fields.description:

When ordering the results from Jira Issues macro by the status of the issues, the order by is incorrect.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.14.2
* Jira 8.0
* Jira Issues Macro 10.0.8
*

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

When adding Data Center apps in Confluence, the License details of the app will show up the number of users signed up in Confluence instead of the final number of licenses for that app. For example, if you purchase a 500-user license, instead of showing this info it will show the number of users signed up.

h3. Environment 
* Confluence Data Center
* Data Center apps

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Install Confluence Data Center
# Install an app in the *Find new add-ons* page. Make sure that this is a Data Center plugin
# Insert your purchased license

h3. Expected Results  

* As in Confluence Server, this should show the total number of licenses of the app, for example, 500-user license

h3. Actual Results 

* It displays, in the License details, the number of users currently signed up

h3.Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Confluence Data Center Apps License Details

com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'conf61502.os_user' doesn't exist

** {code:java}2020-07-14 10:04:57,073 WARN [SiteSummaryCalculator:thread-1] [status.service.systeminfo.UsageInfo] getCountForQuery Unable to execute usage info query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users - Table 'confluence.users' doesn't exist

Granular control over permissions Space admins can grant

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When you whitelist an URL with a trail, it automatically marks the *Type* field as an *Exact Match*. If you change it to *Domain Name*, a warning sign is shown and you are not able to change it back to *Exact Match* since Confluence keeps pulling automatically the *Domain Name* option with a warning sign.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your *Confluence Administration >> Whitelist*
 # In the *Expression* field, add an URL with a trailing slash, for example, [https://www.google.com/] . The *Type* field will automatically show *Exact Match*.
 # Change the *Type* field to *Domain Name*. A warning sign will show up.
 # Change the *Type* field back to *Exact Match*.

h3. Expected Results
 * The *Type* field is changed to *Exact Match*.

h3. Actual Results
 * Confluence keeps pulling automatically the *Domain Name* option with a warning sign instead of changing it to the *Exact Match* option.

h3. Notes
 * If you try to add the URL with the warning sign, it will freeze and won't let you change it until you refresh the page.
 * The warning sign doesn't explain what is the issue with the URL added.

h3. Workaround
 * Remove the trailing slash from the URL and save it as a domain name.
fields.summary: Domain Name field with a warning won't change to Exact Match in Confluence's whitelist

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* When editing an Excel file using the Atlassian Companion app, if the Excel file has hidden columns, they will still be displayed in Confluence.

h3. Suggested Solution  

* If a column is hidden in Excel, keep it hidden in Confluence as well.

h3. Why this is important   

* For some customers it is important and relevant to keep some columns/rows of their Excel files hidden and have it reflected in Confluence using the Atlassian Companion app.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Keep Excel hidden columns/rows hidden in Confluence

fields.description:
h2. Problem Summary

Performance bottlenecks can be triggered by Label related queries on large Confluence instances.
h2. Problem Details

Confluence provides users with a handful of Label related macros. These macros can be used to find the most popular labels in a space, find recently used macros, to get a comprehensive report of pages that have specific labels and so goes on.

The main action behind such functionalities consists of the application going to the database to retrieve a list of labels based on the input provided by the macros. This is exactly where the problem happens, given the nature of the queries. Symptoms observed have been:
 * Overall application slowness.
 * Increased response time on the database size due to what seems to be a huge amount of data returned by the Label queries.
 * Stuck threads waiting to interact with the database - This happens because the Label related threads make the database busy.
 * Need to restart the application to make it usable once again.

h4. Thread Dumps

Thread Dumps generated during situations like the above mentioned one show the application stuck for long time executing an Hibernate Statement in the database. The statement comes from the _findMostPopular_ method:
{code:java}
"http-nio2-8443-exec-277" #512 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f354c055800 nid=0x389c runnable [0x00007f323d893000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(SocketInputStream.java:116)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:171)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:141)
	at sun.security.ssl.InputRecord.readFully(InputRecord.java:465)
	at sun.security.ssl.InputRecord.read(InputRecord.java:503)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readRecord(SSLSocketImpl.java:983)
	- locked <0x00000005dc024f38> (a java.lang.Object)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readDataRecord(SSLSocketImpl.java:940)
	at sun.security.ssl.AppInputStream.read(AppInputStream.java:105)
	- locked <0x00000005dc024ff8> (a sun.security.ssl.AppInputStream)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.readFully(MysqlIO.java:3008)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.reuseAndReadPacket(MysqlIO.java:3469)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.reuseAndReadPacket(MysqlIO.java:3459)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3900)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:2527)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2680)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2487)
	- locked <0x00000005dc025160> (a com.mysql.jdbc.JDBC4Connection)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeInternal(PreparedStatement.java:1858)
	- locked <0x00000005dc025160> (a com.mysql.jdbc.JDBC4Connection)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeQuery(PreparedStatement.java:1966)
	- locked <0x00000005dc025160> (a com.mysql.jdbc.JDBC4Connection)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyPreparedStatement.executeQuery(NewProxyPreparedStatement.java:379)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.BatcherImpl.getResultSet(BatcherImpl.java:89)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.getResultSet(Loader.java:880)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doQuery(Loader.java:273)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doQueryAndInitializeNonLazyCollections(Loader.java:138)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doList(Loader.java:1063)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.list(Loader.java:1054)
	at net.sf.hibernate.hql.QueryTranslator.list(QueryTranslator.java:854)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.find(SessionImpl.java:1570)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.QueryImpl.list(QueryImpl.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao.lambda$findNamedQueryStringParams$5(HibernateObjectDao.java:432)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao$$Lambda$479/1754201883.doInHibernate(Unknown Source)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:370)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.executeFind(HibernateTemplate.java:341)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao.findNamedQueryStringParams(HibernateObjectDao.java:408)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao.findNamedQueryStringParam(HibernateObjectDao.java:308)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.labels.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateLabelDao.performNonMySqlMostPopular(HibernateLabelDao.java:352)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.labels.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateLabelDao.findMostPopular(HibernateLabelDao.java:345)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.labels.DefaultLabelManager.getMostPopularLabels(DefaultLabelManager.java:571)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.labels.CachingLabelManager.lambda$getMostPopularLabels$0(CachingLabelManager.java:219)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.labels.CachingLabelManager$$Lambda$1442/1161219258.apply(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.internal.labels.MostPopularCache.valueWrapper(MostPopularCache.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.internal.labels.MostPopularCache.lambda$getMostPopularGlobal$0(MostPopularCache.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.internal.labels.MostPopularCache$$Lambda$1445/643250503.get(Unknown Source)
{code}
h4. Database Logs

As far as the database logging goes, there are queries that correlates with the above thread dump (they are triggered by _findMostPopular_ method) and that takes a long time to be executed - Usually something in between 5 to 10 minutes:
{code:sql}
SELECT *
  FROM (  SELECT label1_.LABELID AS col_0_0_,
                 CAST (COUNT (labelling0_.LABELID) AS NUMBER (10, 0))
                    AS col_1_0_,
                 label1_.LABELID AS LABELID1_43_,
                 label1_.NAME AS NAME2_43_,
                 label1_.OWNER AS OWNER3_43_,
                 label1_.NAMESPACE AS NAMESPACE4_43_,
                 label1_.CREATIONDATE AS CREATIONDATE5_43_,
                 label1_.LASTMODDATE AS LASTMODDATE6_43_
            FROM CONTENT_LABEL labelling0_, LABEL label1_, CONTENT contentent2_
           WHERE     labelling0_.LABELID = label1_.LABELID
                 AND labelling0_.CONTENTID = contentent2_.CONTENTID
                 AND label1_.NAMESPACE = :1
                 AND contentent2_.CONTENT_STATUS <> 'deleted'
        GROUP BY label1_.LABELID,
                 label1_.NAMESPACE,
                 label1_.OWNER,
                 label1_.NAME,
                 label1_.LASTMODDATE,
                 label1_.CREATIONDATE
        ORDER BY CAST (COUNT (labelling0_.LABELID) AS NUMBER (10, 0)) DESC)
WHERE ROWNUM <= :2
{code}
Another example would be:
{code:sql}
select labelling0_.ID as ID, labelling0_.LABELID as LABELID, labelling0_.CONTENTID as CONTENTID, labelling0_.PAGETEMPLATEID as PAGETEMP4_, labelling0_.OWNER as OWNER, labelling0_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION6_, labelling0_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD7_, labelling0_.LABELABLEID as LABELABL8_, labelling0_.LABELABLETYPE as LABELABL9_ from CONTENT_LABEL labelling0_, LABEL label1_, CONTENT contentent2_ where (labelling0_.LABELID=label1_.LABELID )and(label1_.NAMESPACE='global' )and(contentent2_.CONTENT_STATUS!='deleted'  and labelling0_.CONTENTID=contentent2_.CONTENTID) order by  labelling0_.LASTMODDATE
{code}
Also, the following query represents yet another example:
{code:sql}
SELECT  *
FROM
        (
                SELECT  labelling0_.ID             AS ID1_13_            ,
                        labelling0_.LABELID        AS LABELID2_13_       ,
                        labelling0_.CONTENTID      AS CONTENTID3_13_     ,
                        labelling0_.PAGETEMPLATEID AS PAGETEMPLATEID4_13_,
                        labelling0_.OWNER          AS OWNER5_13_         ,
                        labelling0_.CREATIONDATE   AS CREATIONDATE6_13_  ,
                        labelling0_.LASTMODDATE    AS LASTMODDATE7_13_   ,
                        labelling0_.LABELABLEID    AS LABELABLEID8_13_   ,
                        labelling0_.LABELABLETYPE  AS LABELABLETYPE9_13_
                FROM    CONTENT_LABEL labelling0_,
                        LABEL label1_            ,
                        CONTENT contentent2_
                WHERE   labelling0_.CONTENTID           =contentent2_.CONTENTID
                        AND labelling0_.LABELID         =label1_.LABELID
                        AND label1_.NAMESPACE           ='global'
                        AND contentent2_.CONTENT_STATUS<>'deleted'
                ORDER BY labelling0_.LASTMODDATE DESC
        )
WHERE   rownum <= :1
{code}
h2. Suggested Root Cause

Depending on the size of the Content Table, above queries can be quite expensive and take a long time to run. To know the size of one's instance, run the following query:
{code:sql}
select content_status, count(*) from content group by content_status;
{code}
Tests show that instances with 15M entries in the Content table can take up to 90s to have the above queries returning results, regardless of indexes. Therefore, the problem is related to the scalability of the Label logic in Confluence.
h2. Which action can trigger such queries?
 * Through a call to _/labels/autocompletelabel.action_ - This is a call to retrieve a list of labels to auto complete an user input when one is adding labels to a page. This call will only jeopardise the application health if there's no Contend ID in the URL - For example, when adding labels to an unpublished page where Content ID is still not referenced in the URL.
 * When using the _Popular Labels_ Macro without a Space Key defined on it:
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-15 at 17.53.32.png|thumbnail!

h2. Workaround

There are a few things we can do to mitigate the impact of this problem:
 # To block calls to __/labels/autocompletelabel.action__ in a Proxy/Tomcat level. Downside is that auto-completion of labels won't work.
 # To enforce users to define a Space Key when adding the _Popular Labels_ Macro.

*Extra:*
 In order to know which pages have the _Popular Labels_ Macro without a Space Key set to it, one can run the query below - It has been tested in PostgreSQL and there may be a need to tweak it a little bit for other database flavours:
{code:sql}
select c.title, c.contentid, s.spacekey from content c, spaces s where contentid in (
select contentid from bodycontent where body like '%ac:name="popular-labels"%' and body not ilike'%<ac:parameter ac:name="spaceKey">%') 
and c.prevver is null and c.spaceid = s.spaceid;
{code}
With the above list in hands, one can go to each page and edit the Macro to have a Space Key on it to workaround the performance issue.
fields.summary: Performance Issues on Confluence caused by Label related queries

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence DC is configured with SAML SSO, when a new user logs in he/she is not added to confluence-users group automatically.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.6.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup Confluence DC with SAML SSO
 # Create User Directory with type as delegated or connector with local groups
 # Configure the default setting to add user to confluence-users group
 # Attempt to login

 
h3. Reference

This issue was also previously tracked through [SAMLDC-48|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SAMLDC-48]

h3. Expected Results
 * New user logged in should be automatically added to the default group/confluence-user group.

h3. Actual Results
 * New user logged in is not automatically added to the default group/confluence-user group.

h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: SAML doesn't work with defaults groups on authentication feature

fields.description:
Currently, the Alpine Linux Docker images are about the same size of the Ubuntu images, sometimes slightly bigger. As the value of Alpine is in great part its lower footprint, having bigger Alpine images somewhat defeats their purpose. 

The Dockerfile used by Atlassian for Alpine and Ubuntu respectively use:
Alpine: FROM adoptopenjdk/openjdk8:alpine
Ubuntu: FROM adoptopenjdk/openjdk8:slim

The 'slim' version of adoptopenjdk is important. There is a 'slim' version for Alpine but Atlassian does not seem to use it:
adoptopenjdk/openjdk8:alpine-slim

I think this is valuable improvement to the Alpine images for Confluence (saves 150M).
fields.summary: Use AdoptOpenJDK Slim on Alpine Linux Docker images in order to decrease the image size

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Searching for user Willsomething by using Will will return all users up to 10 in the permission list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create users Test1, Test2, Willsomething1, Willsomething2 as username
 # Search for user "Will" in Global permissions and observe the suggestions.

h3. Expected Results
# Only and both Willsomething1, Willsomething2 will be visible in the list

h3. Actual Results
All users (up to functionality limit of 10) will be visible. In this case:
 Test1, Test2, Willsomething1, Willsomething2

h3. Notes
The issue is not replicable with for example names "Gojko" or "Gojjko" so it appears to be related to 4 letters tokenization of the word "Will"


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Searching for user Willsomething by using Will will return all users up to 10 in permission list.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When disabling a Confluence App (aka plugin or add-on), Confluence will automatically disable any other App that has a strong dependency on the former (or a module of it) with no warning messag in the UI.
For example, when disabling _Confluence Jira Plugin_, _confluence-software-blueprints_ will be disabled because the latter has a strong dependency on the {{jqlHelper}} module of the former.

h3. Suggested Solution
Before disabling an App, Confluence should check if any other has a dependency on it.
If there's any, then Confluence should advise that disabling _App A_ will cause _App B_ to be disabled.

h3. Why this is important
There's no clear definition on Apps' dependency on the Confluence UI when administering Apps.
That means Confluence admin might take an action without knowing the full consequences of it.
 
h3. Workaround 
_no workaround so far_
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator I would like to know if any App would be affected when disabling another App or a module of another App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence [Audit log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/audit-log-829076528.html] documentation it says that enabling or disabling Apps actions are recorded in the Audit log.
When an App is automatically disabled, because of a dependency for example, this is not recorded in the audit log.

h3. Environment
This was validated on Confluence Server *6.6.12* and *6.13.2*.
The test below uses  _Confluence Mobile App Plugin_ just as an example. This will affect other Apps as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a Confluence vanilla instance.
# Make sure audit log is enabled (it is by default).
# Disable _Confluence Mobile App Plugin_.
# As a result, _Workbox - Host Plugin_ is also disabled.
# Go to the _Audit log_ admin UI.

h3. Expected Results
The following entries are logged:
 # Add-on disabled: Confluence Mobile Web Plugin.
 # Add-on disabled: Workbox - Host Plugin.

h3. Actual Results
Only the action related to the App manually disabled is recorded -- in the example, _Confluence Mobile Web Plugin_.
There's no entry saying the _Workbox - Host Plugin_ was disabled as a result of this action.

h3. Additional Notes
In addition to the example above, an event is not recorded in the audit logs when an App is automatically disabled because of any internal problem within Confluence (or the App itself).

h3. Workaround
_Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available_
fields.summary: Confluence Apps and modules automatically disabled does not create an entry in the audit log

fields.description:
While deleting a parent page along with child pages, currently, details on child pages are not captured.

Changes are stamped as "Page Hierarchy Delete Started" irrespective if it's an individual page or if it's a parent page (including child pages) so it is difficult to distinguish between both.
fields.summary: Audit log not capturing child page information when deleting the parent page including child pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing Questions for Confluence as an anonymous or logged out user, you are presented with an option to Log In to Confluence after clicking "Ask a Question".  Clicking on this brings you to a login page at {{/login.action?os_destination=%252Fquestions}}.  Once you attempt to login, you receive a HTTP Status 400 error with the following details:

{quote}HTTP Status 400 – Bad Request

Type Status Report

Message Invalid URI: noSlash

Description The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).{quote}

This is likely because of the "25" in the URL.  If you browse to {{/login.action?os_destination=%2Fquestions}} you can login without issue.

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log out of Confluence
# Click on Questions in the top navigation bar
# Click on Ask a Question
# Click on Log In
# Attempt to Log in

h3. Expected Results

You are logged in and able to write your Question.

h3. Actual Results

You are presented with the HTTP Status 400 error.

h3. Workaround

The current workaround is to log in using the standard Confluence log in button, or remove the 25 from the URL before logging in, like:

{{confluenceurl/login.action?os_destination=%2Fquestions}}
fields.summary: When clicking on Log in button provided by Questions for Confluence, there is an Invalid Redirect error

fields.description:
When creating Tables with a few rows, it would be nice to be able to set the 'Fixed height' for the row just like the 'Fixed width' for the column.

h4. Current Setting
If you enter a long content in the box, the row height is automatically adjusted to the texts entered.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Expected setting
If the box has a long content, we can use the scroll instead of adjusting the row height according to the content.
fields.summary: Support for Fixed height of rows in Tables

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Suppose the following operation in Universal Plugin Manager--
 # Enable partial modules in any plugin
 # Enable any other Plugin

Then the first modules are reverted to disabled state in BANDANA table even though GUI displays wrongly as it is still enabled. 
h3. Environment

Data center with two nodes
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Confluence
 # Go to Universal Plugin Manager
 # Enable HTML module in Confluence HTML Macros
 # Enable Confluence Mail Archiving Plugin

h3. Expected Results

The modules below are enabled in GUI of Universal Plugin Manager
 * HTML module in Confluence HTML Macros
 * Confluence Mail Archiving Plugin

Besides, the query result
{code:java}
select BANDANAVALUE from BANDANA where BANDANAKEY = 'plugin.manager.state.Map'
{code}
includes following values.
{code:none}
<entry>                                                                                                                                        
     <string>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mail-archiving</string>                                                      
     <boolean>true</boolean>                                                                                                                     
</entry>                                                                                                                                       
{code}
and
{code:none}
<entry>                                                    
     <string>confluence.macros.html:html</string>             
     <boolean>true</boolean>                                  
</entry>                                                   
{code}
h3. Actual Results

The modules below are enabled in GUI of Universal Plugin Manager
 * HTML module in Confluence HTML Macros
 * Confluence Mail Archiving Plugin

However the above query result includes *only* below.
{code:none}
<entry>                                                                                                                                        
     <string>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mail-archiving</string>                                                      
     <boolean>true</boolean>                                                                                                                     
</entry>                                                                                                                                       
{code}
i.e. The entry for {{confluence.macros.html:html}} was lost.
h3. Workaround

Enable the modules manually from Universal Plugin Manager after restarting Confluence.
fields.summary: Enabling partial modules is not effective if plugin is enabled later in Universal Plugin Manager

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using Attachments macro in Confluence for attachments with a lot of versions, we to have to scroll all the way down for the options to Preview / View / Properties / Delete, see screenshots below:

 !Screen Shot 2019-04-05 at 11.32.05.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-05 at 11.32.15.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

It would make it a lot easier if those buttons were displayed above the Version History list.

h3. Why this is important
 
When attachments have a lot of previous versions it is not practical to have to scroll all the way down to be able to Preview, View or Delete the attachment.
The above screenshots I show 50 versions of a file but in many other cases there can be a lot more.
fields.summary: Attachments macro could have the "Preview / View / Properties / Delete" options above the "Version History"

fields.description:
Suggestion is that the script in the Confluence install program use rpm instead of yum to detect the fontconfig lib in the RedHat branch of the fontconfig detection script as 'rpm -q fontconfig' could be used instead of 'yum list installed fontconfig' which is used today, and when using rpm the CIS umask enhancements does not hinder the query.

The problem is that when CIS is in play the umask for root is set to 077 instead of as usual 022, and this leads to when packages are installed with yum the yum specific files (and most likely some others too) ends up having access permissions set so unprivileged users cannot use yum to detect if a package is installed. If rpm is used to detect the package there is no problem.
fields.summary: Improve installer to detect fonts against rpm instead of yum.

fields.description:
Livesearch search result only show results from page or file title matches while the new search bar (in confluence 6,14+) show all search results directly. 

It is unintuitive for the end user that one searchbox suggestions does not match the other searchbox from the sidebar-search.

Please update livesearch to include option to show full search result, just like the search bar.
fields.summary: Livesearch search result like search-bar
Cloud Migration Assistant app shows up in the list of apps even after being uninstalled

fields.description:
h3. Summary When placing macros back to back the editor in a page in Confluence 5.10.x, the preview and the saved mode looks fine. However, upgrading it to Confluence 6.x version, the page looks fine in preview mode but adds in extra space after the *Excerpt Macro* upon saving the page. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page in Confluence 5.10.x # Insert an *Excerpt macro* one after another (adding some notes in it) # Save the page # The page looks fine in both edit and preview mode. # Upgrade the Confluence 5.10.x to Confluence 6.x # Edit the page with the *Excerpt macro* (looks fine in edit mode) # Save the page (extra line added after the *Excerpt macro*) # When you go back to edit mode again, you will see the extra line now. h3. Expected Results There should not be extra lines after the *Excerpt macro* !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! h3. Actual Results There is an extra line added after *Excerpt macro* (
) !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! h3. Workaround # Remove the extra space manually from the Edit mode and save the Page again. # Remove the
after the *Excerpt Macro* in the 'Source Editor'
fields.summary: get added after the Excerpt Macros once the page is saved upon upgrade

Calendar is imported

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

System app atlassian-gadgets-shared-4.3.2.jar stays disabled and with an error "This app couldn't be loaded. It has one or more errors that prevent it from being enabled."
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Once Confluence is up and running go to Manage Apps > Choose System Apps from the drop-down
 # atlassian-gadgets-shared-4.3.2.jar will be disabled by default

 !Screen Shot 2019-04-04 at 2.06.54 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

System app atlassian-gadgets-shared-4.3.2.jar to be enabled from the UI

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: System App atlassian-gadgets-shared-4.3.2.jar cannot be enabled

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
# When using IE 11, multiple rows and columns of a table cannot be selected using the mouse or keyboard.
# Issue does not persist on Firefox and Chrome
# Issue does not persist on Confluence 6.11 and Confluence 6.6.12

h4. Steps to replicate in IE 11
# Create a table in a page, with a few rows and columns.
# Try selecting a few of the rows and columns using the mouse, and applying a background color change.
** The change is only applied to the last cell
# Try selecting a few of the rows and columns using the keyboard (Shift + Arrow key), and applying a color change
** The change is only applied to the first cell
# The color change is just an example, and all actions done by the selection has the same issue.
# Issue persist with collaborative editing on and off.

h4. Current behavior
# Unable to select multiple cells of a table in IE11 and Edge

h4. Expected behavior 
# Be able to select multiple cells of table in IE11 and Edge as we could in Firefox and Chrome

h4. Workaround
# No known workaround.
fields.summary: Table selection not working in IE11 and Edge using mouse or keyboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the instance or the user has the language set as Chinese, the tool tip for the tasks breaks and show text that was not supposed to appear.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.14.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the instance / profile language (be sure you are not using browser language if you happen to be using English)
 # Enter the editor
 # Check the editor tool tip for tasks

h3. Expected Results
The tool tip is displayed using the selected language and no additional text is shown

h3. Actual Results
The tool tip is shown but there is incoherent text

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Changing instance language to Chinese breaks tool tip for tasks

fields.description:
h3. Environment
 * Tested in Confluence 6.14.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table with 3 columns and 3 row
 # Merge all cells in the last row 
 # Use *Tab Key* at the very last column to add a new row after

h3. Expected Results

Row is added using *Tab Key*
h3. Actual Results

Row is not added using *Tab Key*

h3. Workaround
# Click the editor option to *insert row after*.
# Click on the *Split merge table cell* to split cell for the added row.
fields.summary: Cannot insert table row using tab key with merge cell

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User macros that contains {{params}} will trigger a Macro Browser upon called. This popup will break and have an infinite loading spinning wheel after a restart.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Confluence Admin > User Macro > Create a new user macro with the following sample default setting:
 !CONFSERVER-58114-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !CONFSERVER-58114-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Edit a page, and try to call the user macro > Make sure it's working properly
# Restart Confluence
# Attempt to call the user macro again

h3. Expected Results
Able to call the user macro and able to choose the parameters

h3. Actual Results
Infinite loading spinning wheel seen:
 !CONFSERVER-58114-3.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
Edit and save the user macro without any changes

h3. Notes
Not seeing this issue in 6.15.1
fields.summary: User Macro Popup Browser breaks after a Confluence restart

fields.description:
We would like to add customizable badges to Questions, similar to what the Atlassian Community currently offers [Community Badges described in detail here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/How-to-earn-badges-on-the-Atlassian-Community/ba-p/729801]. Other gamification features may include customizable leader boards, topic champions and weekly featured answers. 

This suggestion is an extension of this feature [CONFSERVER-58027|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-58027] *Provide the Ability for to adjust the Questions Reputation Thresholds Via UI*
fields.summary: Add Customizable Badges and other Customizable Gamification features in Confluence Questions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the user has Confluence that integrates with JIRA 8, the user will not be able to pull _Jira Issue Dates_ events into team calendars. Additionally other bugs have similar findings: 
[CONFSERVER-58025|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-58025]
[CONFSERVER-57960|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-57960]
[JRASERVER-68903|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-68903] - This is likely the root cause of the problem

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 8
 # Create Application link with JIRA 8
 ## Select (shared users) to have OAUTH (impersonation)
 # Install Team Calendar
 # Add a JIRA issue date event

h3. Expected Results
The user is able to create the JIRA event, select issue due date and the events would then appear on the calendar on the appropriate date.

h3. Actual Results
The user is able to create the JIRA (8.0.0) Issue Event, but Jira issues with due dates never show up on the calendar. In Jira 7 this works as expected.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Customer cannot pull Jira (8.0) issue dates events to Team Calendars

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On Confluence, when creating a new page comment it will notify page watchers about the added comment.
If the page has too many watchers (thousands), then adding the new comment may take a long time to complete.
This also occurs if you have few watchers (dozens) and nested groups is enabled and in use.

h3. Environment
This was validated on Confluence Server 6.6.8, but might impact Data Center deployments and more recent versions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a Confluence vanilla instance.
# Add 5,000 users to this instance.
# Create a sample page and add thousands of users as watchers to this page.
 #* For example, test it with 2k and 4k watchers.
# Add a comment to the page.

h3. Expected Results
Even with a large number of watchers, adding a comment should instantly save the comment and release the UI to the users so they can continue to navigate on Confluence.

h3. Actual Results
It may take several seconds to save the comment and release the UI to the user and, depending on the configuration, the operation will timeout, although it will still continue on the backend giving the perception to the user that it failed.
During the tests, it took ~30s to save the comment with 2k watchers and ~150s with 4k.

If we take a thread dump while the operation is still running on the UI, the below stack trace may be captured:

{code}

The {{saveComment}} method publishes an event about the new comment added to the page.
This is when the {{workbox}} plugin code comes into play with the {{onCommentCreatedEvent}} method, which will then run the entire process to check if the watcher has the necessary permissions before getting the notification.
This permission check is costly and can be exasperated if nested groups are in use, creating the issue even with dozen of watchers.

As a good user experience practice, Confluence should perform all the validations related to the notification in a separated thread, quickly saving the comment and releasing the UI to the user.

h3. Workaround
_none so far_
fields.summary: Adding a page comment may take a long time to complete

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to copy and paste the tables on Windows 10 when using Edge browser
h3. Environment
 * Microsoft Windows 10
 * Microsoft Edge
 * Confluence 6.14.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table on blank page
 # Select all cells in a table
 # Right-click on the table and choose *Copy*
 # On a separate tab, open a new page
 # Right-click and choose *Paste*

h3. Expected Results
 * Table is pasted with all its structure preserved

h3. Actual Results
 * Only table contents are pasted, the table is not included

h3. Notes

Not observed on 6.9.1
Same observed if using the keyboard shortcut
Including content outside of a table does not work
h3. Workaround

The issue is not observed on Mac OS
The issue is not observed on Chrome regardless of OS
Using the Table control menu in confluence to copy and paste rows/columns while the table is selected:
 # Select whole table
 # In the top bar click *Copy table row* or Ctrl+Shift+C
 # !copy.png|thumbnail!
 # In new space and page, insert a small one cell table to bring up the Table Management menu
 # Then paste your table using *Paste table row* or Ctrl+Shift+V
 # !paste.png|thumbnail!
 # You might need to delete that one small cell you created
 # Should work the same with copying and pasting columns
fields.summary: Pasting a table while using Edge from Windows 10 will only paste the text

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to use the search for link function the long page titles go off the screen and do not wrap around. This makes choosing a link impossible and requires the customer to either guess or manually load the page they need as a separate page then copy the link and apply. Hover the page title also does not give the full title of the page.

h3. Actual Result
The page title has been truncated, and it is not possible to identify which page should be inserted in the case below
!manual.jpg|width=500! 

Also happens with different macros when searching for a long page title:
 !Test_Title.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result
* Able to configure the length of the title should be displayed
* Hover the page title should be able to show the full title of the page

h3. Workaround
Navigate to the page then copy the link and apply
fields.summary: Possible to configure the length of the page title that could be displayed in the insert search box

fields.description:
Hello!

I love Confluence, but in a recent update, while searching for a specific page title, we have to type out a whole word for the system to search for it properly whereas before, we could merely begin typing the first few letters of a page name and it would populate that in the search. 

For example: I now have to type in "Washington" before I can find our page called "Washington County, Oregon". 

Before the update, I could merely type in "wash" and that page would come up as a searchable page. 

 

I understand this may free any memory/speed up, but it really helps us out to not have to type out the full word. Some pages we have on here have some complicated names and we would love to not have to type out a long winded word/phrase.

h4. Workaround
Adding a wildcard * at the end of the search term, For example *wash** helps to obtain the search result for incomplete search term.

h4. Notes
It will be more helpful if we can introduce a message in the search result to inform users that truncation with * is required. Example message:
{quote}
Nothing found? Try truncation with *, e.g. wash*
{quote}
fields.summary: Confluence Search Feature Update - Unnecessary to type out entire word of a title of a specific content (page/attachment)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user inserts a JIRA issue into a table cell via *either*:
* The macro browser menu item 
* Shortcut key (CTRL+Shift+J) 

The Jira macro will get placed after the last JIRA issue that user inserted on the page and not in cursor position.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.14
* Replicable on multiple browsers

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a 2x2 table into a page
# Place cursor at row 1 column 1
# Use the shortcut key (CTRL+Shift+J) to insert a *single* Jira issue
# Place cursor at row 1 column 2
# Use the shortcut key (CTRL+Shift+J) to insert another *single* Jira issue

h3. Screencast
 [^Recording #8.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
The second Jira macro will place at row 1 column 2

h3. Actual Results
The second Jira macro will place at row 1 column 1

h3. Workaround
* Use the shortcut key by typing in "{" to bring up the macro browser, type in "Jira" to bring up the same Jira macro pop up screen to insert the Jira issue.
* Inserts a random character at the cursor position and then inserts the Jira macro (with any method)
fields.summary: Jira macros does not honour cursor position in table cells

fields.description: It would be very helpful to not only see content changes in the page history but also see changes in the page title, especially by comparison of two versions of a page.
fields.summary: Display changes in page title also in page history

fields.description:
Confluence Server and Data Center had a path traversal vulnerability in the downloadallattachments resource. A remote attacker who has permission to add attachments to pages and / or blogs or to create a new space or a personal space or who has 'Admin' permissions for a space can exploit this path traversal vulnerability to write files to arbitrary locations which can lead to remote code execution on systems that run a vulnerable version of Confluence Server or Data Center. 

*Affected versions:*
* All versions of Confluence Server from 2.0.0 before 6.6.13 (the fixed version for 6.6.x), from 6.7.0 before 6.12.4 (the fixed version for 6.12.x), from 6.13.0 before 6.13.4 (the fixed version for 6.13.x), from 6.14.0 before 6.14.3 (the fixed version for 6.14.x), and from 6.15.0 before 6.15.2  are affected by this vulnerability. 

*Fix:*
 * Confluence Server and Data Center versions 6.15.2 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download].
 * Confluence Server and Data Center versions 6.14.3 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].
 * Confluence Server and Data Center versions 6.13.4 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].
 * Confluence Server and Data Center versions 6.12.4 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].
 * Confluence Server and Data Center versions 6.6.13 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].


For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/d5e8OQ].
fields.summary: Confluence - Path traversal vulnerability - CVE-2019-3398
Confluence 7.0 EAP Feedback - Compile Errors

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copying and pasting a status macro (or TOC) over https in the browser will trigger mix content action, it will break the certificate trust on request of:

Status macro
* {{plugins/servlet/status-macro/placeholder?title=titlehere&colour=Yellow}}

TOC macro
* {{/plugins/servlet/confluence/placeholder/macro?definition=e3RvY30&locale=en_US&version=2}}

h3. Environment

 Confluence 6.14.0
 Confluence 6.14.1
 Confluence 6.14.2
 Connector with SSL

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and add a status macro (or TOC macro)
 # Open inspect tools/network tab and edit the page
 # Copy and paste the status macro

h3. Expected Results

The status macro is pasted.
h3. Actual Results

The requests are resolved over HTTP and certificate is not trusted because of mixed content.
h3. Notes

The issue does not exist in 6.13.0

h3. Workaround for NGINX

If a reverse proxy is in use such as NGINX, adding a section to the proxy configuration file to redirect HTTP to HTTPS will address the problem:

{code:java}
server{
	listen 80 default_server;
	listen [::]:80 default_server;
	server_name _;
	return 301 https://$host$request_uri;
}
{code}

h3. Workaround for Apache

If a reverse proxy is in use such as Apache, adding a section to the proxy configuration file to redirect HTTP to HTTPS will address the problem:

{code}
Listen 80

<VirtualHost *:80>
    ServerName _
    RewriteEngine On
    RewriteRule (.*) https://%{HTTP_HOST}%{REQUEST_URI} [L,NE,R=301]
</VirtualHost>
{code}

h3. Update (4/26)

This issue has also been reported when copying/pasting the Jira Issues macro.

h3. Update 5/21

This issue has also been reported when copying/pasting emoticons.
fields.summary: Copying and pasting Status Macro (or TOC Macro) over https triggers mixed content and breaks certificate trust

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding a second connector to server.xml, during Confluence boot a false positive warning about missing maximum HTTP Thread (maxThreads) value not being configured on both of them, despite it's being correctly set.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.15.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Modify Confluence server.xml by adding a second connector with unique port
 # Restart Confluence

h3. Expected Results
 * Confluence booth and operates without any issues

h3. Actual Results
 * Confluence boots and works, but logs a false positive warning in atlassian.confluence.log
{code:java}
 
2019-03-29 14:06:40,518 WARN [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.impl.health.DefaultHealthCheckRunner] logEvent Your maximum HTTP Thread size is not configured. The recommended minimum size is 48.
2019-03-29 14:06:40,518 WARN [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.impl.health.DefaultHealthCheckRunner] logEvent Your maximum HTTP Thread size is not configured. The recommended minimum size is 48.
{code}
h3. Notes

 * We also see on the UI a warning like the following when starting Confluence for the first time after upgrade:

!image-2020-12-04-14-53-11-820.png|width=547,height=224!
 * maxThreads value is set correctly on both connectors

h3. Workaround
 * The issue is cosmetic and warning can be ignored
 * Disabling/uncommenting second connector will stop the warning
fields.summary: Adding a second connector to server.xml will result in a false positive missing maxThreads warning in logs

fields.description:
h3. Environment

Confluence 6.15.1
h3. Description

It is not possible to open xls file with row count than 100000. There is currently a *-Dofficeconnector.spreadsheet.xlsxmaxsize* JVM parameter which allows admins to configure the maximum file size but the file must still have fewer than 100,000 cells which is not configurable. It would be nice to provide a configuration option to open files that have more than 100,000 cells.

The limit is set in the SpreadsheetConverter class in the document-conversion-library.
h3. Symptoms
 * Error message is displayed:
{code:java}
We can't preview this file. 
You'll have to download the file to view it.
{code}

 * Logs contain following error:
{code:java}
Error rendering macro 'viewxls' : com.benryan.conversion.ConversionException: Cannot convert spreadsheet, the number of cells: 196605 is greater than the maximum allowed cells: 100000
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Allow maximum cell count to be configurable to be higher than default 100000 using JVM parameter

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
# Create from template macro does not work when places in a table header.
# Works as expected when used in any other row\column of the table.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create a table in Confluence
# Add the "Create from template" macro onto the header (First Row of the table).
# Add the "Create from template" macro onto any other row, and save the page.
# Using the macro on the header will bring you to Confluence's home page.
# Using the macro anywhere else will bring you to a page with the template selected.

h4. Current behavior
# Using the "Create from template" macro placed in a table header brings you to the Confluence home page.

h4. Expected behavior
# Using the "Create from template" macro placed in a table header should work as expected and bring the user to the page created using the macro.
fields.summary: Create from template macro does not work when places in a table header

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Event type selections on Team Calendars does not persist on calendar specific views after refreshing the page, or navigating away and returning.
h5. Repro Steps
 # Go to a calendar page [https://base-url/display/SPACEKEY/calendars] - This will give you a conglomerate of all the calendars you have added to the space calendars.
 # Click on one of the calendars within that space- You will directed to the calendar-specific view with a url like this
 [https://base-url/display/SPACEKEY/calendar/xd7fd1cx-x7fr-3609-bexcb-d9b445fbdfz3?calendarName=Test%20Cal]
 # From this calendar-specific view, uncheck an event type to remove those from the display
 # Refresh the page, the selection does not persist (This is the problem), requiring you to unselect the Event Types again.

Screenshot:

!image-2019-03-27-17-19-35-178.png!
h3. Workaround

Instead of using the Calendar-specific view, utilize the My Calendars page, or the Space Calendars page. These views persist the view state after a refresh of the page.

For example, go to [https://base-url/calendar/mycalendar.action] or [https://base-url/display/SPACEKEY/calendars] and add 
 "Your Calendar" or any calendar, and you will be able to maintain the selected and unselected options across a page refresh.
fields.summary: Confluence should persist the view state in Team Calendars on calendar specific views

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Personal spaces can only be created when the user follows the steps in [Create your personal space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/create-your-personal-space-777010869.html].
Currently, there's no option to automatically create a Personal Space for every user in Confluence that has the _Personal Space_ permissions.

h3. Suggested Solution
If the user has the _Personal Space_ [global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/global-permissions-overview-138709.html], create a personal space on the first login.
It could even be an opt-out option on the on-boarding plugin.

h3. Workaround 
The Confluence administrator can create the personal space of a user by running the [{{addPersonalSpace}} RPC API method|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/remote-confluence-methods/#management].
Below is an example of how to run that method using {{curl}}.
{code}
ADMIN_USRNAME=admin
ADMIN_PWD=admin
CONFBASEURL=http://localhost:26611/c6611/
TARGET_USERNAME=user007
 
curl --user $ADMIN_USRNAME:$ADMIN_PWD -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" -X POST -d "{ \"jsonrpc\" : \"2.0\", \"method\" : \"addPersonalSpace\", \"params\" : [{\"name\" : \"$TARGET_USERNAME\", \"spaceGroup\": null, \"type\": \"personal\"}, \"$TARGET_USERNAME\"], \"id\": 7 }" $CONFBASEURL/rpc/json-rpc/confluenceservice-v2?os_authType=basic
{code}
(!) Note that this RPC API method bypasses _Personal Space_ [global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/global-permissions-overview-138709.html], so it will create the space even if the target user doesn't have it.

With this, the admin can create an automation to add a Personal Space for new users after validating this user has the _Personal Space_ [global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/global-permissions-overview-138709.html].
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator I would like to automatically create a Personal Space on user's first login

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When the Confluence user doesn't have a Personal Space, the _Create from template_ button will automatically determine a target Space, which will be set as a default option in the _Select Space_ drop-down list. This Space might be randomly chosen from the user perspective.
This may create confusion, since some users might not have the understanding where the page is being placed and save pages in Spaces they have the create content permissions, but don't usually curate content.
This only occurs when the user is *not* accessing a page within a Space. That means it happens on dashboard pages, view profile, and other similar pages.

h3. Suggested Solution
*When accessing non Space pages*:
When a user clicks on the _Create from template_ button it will open the _Create_ window so the user can choose the target space and the template of the new page.
In that window the _Select space_ drop-down list should not have a default Space selected, requiring the user to choose a space by themselves.

*When accessing Space pages*:
The current logic should be used, automatically assigning the default to the current space.

h3. Why this is important
With more users joining Confluence, specially those that are not IT savvy, this suggestion can prevent confusion and have content created in the proper Space.

h3. Workaround 
_none so far_
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator I would like that a default Space is not selected when a user clicks on the Create from template button

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When the Confluence user doesn't have a Personal Space, the _Create blank page_ button will automatically determine the target Space when a user is browsing dashboard pages. This target Space might be randomly chosen from the user perspective.
This may create confusion, since some users might not have the understanding where the page is being placed and save the pages in Spaces they have the create content permissions, but don't usually curate content.

h3. Suggested Solution
When a user is not in a specific Space and clicks on the Create blank page button, Confluence should ask which space instead of automatically assigning a default one when the user doesn't have a Personal Space.
How the buttons works could be a configuration option available to the Confluence administrator between the two options below:
 # _Create blank page button_ automatically chooses a Space based on the current logic.
 # When clicked, _Create blank page button_ asks the user which Space they want to create the blank page.

h3. Why this is important
With more users joining Confluence, specially those that are not IT savvy, this suggestion can prevent confusion and have content created in the proper Space.

h3. Workaround 
As a workaround, Confluence administrator may choose to disable the _Create blank page_ button, reverting the functionality to something similar prior to [Confluence 5.9|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-5-9-release-notes-785333580.html#Confluence5.9ReleaseNotes-One-clickcreateforblankpages] when the _Quick Create_ functionality was released.
To achieve this, Confluence admin needs to [add the following JVM property|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-system-properties-168002854.html] to the startup script of your Confluence instance and restart the application.
{code}
-Datlassian.darkfeature.clc.quick.create=false
{code}
fields.summary: As a Confluence user I would like to choose a target Space when I click the Create blank page button

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
 # Certain sites do not allow images to be downloaded, or viewed unless the request is from a browser.
 # If we were to use these images in a Confluence to be displayed via URL, the image will load on the page in Confluence, but on PDF exports, it will not be displayed.
 # The following warning will appear in the log as well.
 ** 
{code:java}
2019-03-27 17:12:31,269 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [confluence.extra.flyingpdf.ConfluenceExportUserAgent] getImageResource Could not retrieve image resource https://dk.farnell.com/productimages/standard/en_GB/1865279-40.jpg during Confluence export
 -- url: /spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action | page: 2916353 | traceId: 9db6edf865f219b1 | userName: root | referer: http://localhost:8090/display/S1/SimplePage.txt | action: pdfpageexport{code}

 # This is because the PDF export request for the image on the server side, and the site does not allow the image to be download that way.
 # Also, since the server will take some time to process this request, if there's a lot of these type of images on a page, the request might become long running and hang.

h4. Sample image URLs
 # [https://dk.farnell.com/productimages/standard/en_GB/1865279-40.jpg]
 # [https://dk.farnell.com/productimages/standard/en_GB/b&k-precision-bk2831e-40.jpg]

h4. Sample of a URL without any issues found online
 # [https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/I/91eYwmmel5L._SL1500_.jpg]

h4. Test
 # We can know if the image would be affected or not by running the _wget_ command on the server that Confluence is on, against those URLs.
 ** !wget-images.PNG|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround
# Get the image from the browser, and upload it to Confluence.

h4. Note
# Do note that a lot of these sites prevent this to protect their sites from being [ripped|https://whatis.techtarget.com/definition/ripping-digital-extraction].
# It would also be a good idea to show in the UI if we hit into these type of images during a PDF export, so that the user is aware of the issue.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence to be able to export images from URL of sites that do not allow images to be downloaded via non browser request
