fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding Jira 8.0 gadgets to Confluence, random fields in gadgets will display as *_MSG_gadget* instead of the actual fields. At the same time, actual gadget titles will remain correct in the macro browser, the issue is observed in preview and on the pages.
On Jira side, gadgets will remain functional

h3. Environment
* Jira 8.0
* Confluence 6.14.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect Confluence 6.14.1 to Jira 8.0
 # Add Jira gadget feed 
 # Add Some Jira Gadgets to a confluence page, for example, *Issue Statistics*

h3. Expected Results
 * Gadget is added and correctly populated in Confluence

h3. Actual Results
 * Gadget preview is showing bellow in the title, in both preview and on the page.
{code:borderStyle=solid}
__MSG_gadget.stats.statistics__: PROJ (Assignee)
{code}

!Screen Shot 2019-03-26 at 14.15.07.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Same is observed if the gadget is added directly or via gadget feed
Almost all gadgets are affected
The issue is observed regardless if Jira or Confluence are behind a proxy
Gadget titles will remain correct, if your gadget titles are showing wrong, please refer to [How to fix gadget titles showing as __MSG_gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-fix-gadget-titles-showing-as-__msg_gadget-813697086.html] KB.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Gadgets on Confluence will show _MSG_gadget messages instead of some fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

During installation, there is no option to disable Launch on Startup for Atlassian Companion App. for both .exe and .msi packages. Only once it is launched, we can disable the option.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add an option during installation, where this can be disabled.
* For MSI packages, we can implement something similar to Roaming profiles that can be configured deploying through MSI package, we can try to add an option for this configuration as well.

h3. Why this is important
The customer has complained that they don't want the Companion app to automatically launch for all users. As many users don't need or use this app, it creates unnecessary confusion for the users and also cause drain on resources.

h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
After first launch of the app, the user can disable the Automatic Launch on Startup.
fields.summary: Option to disable Launch On Startup during installation of Atlassian Companion app

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
# Right now, if a user would like to share a page in a Space to be edited by another user, they will need to grant that user the Add Page permission.
# This might not be the requirement of the user, as they would not want the user they're adding to add pages to a Space, but to only edit existing pages.
# This ticket is a duplicate of the CONFSERVER-26522 suggestion ticket that was closed on 2012.

h4. Current Behavior
# User will need to have the *Add Page* permission in order to edit existing pages.

h4. Suggested Behavior
# Create a separate permission called *Edit Page*, that would allow users with the permission to edit pages in a Space without the permission to add or create more pages.
fields.summary: Allow users to edit pages in Confluence without the Add page permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary
We have currently implemented some reports using CQL queries. However, we have realized that we are not able to sort by content properties.

Having the ability to do this would really help us to properly implement our features.

h3. Note
This [documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/content-properties-in-the-rest-api/#cql-search-extension] was followed, but sorting also does not work not only for strings and texts but also with dates.
fields.summary: Sortable custom content properties

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding the Word Doc macro to display a Word document which contains a copy of an Excel chart with a logarithmic scale, Confluence will encounter slow performance issues and encounter a Java Heap issue after saving the page with the Word document.

*UPDATE:* This bug can also occur when viewing directly an Excel file with logarithmic scale attached to a page or any office file that contains an Excel file with logarithmic scale.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Word Document and embed an Excel chart with a logarithmic scale.
 # Upload file as an attachment to any Confluence Space (this alone will not cause the issue)
 # Use the View Doc (Word ver) macro to display (not link) the Word Document on any page
 # Save Page

h3. Expected Results

Once saved, the Confluence page should show the contents of the Word Document on the page.
h3. Actual Results

A Java Heap error will display on the page, causing slow performance on the instance. The following is shown in the logs:
{code:java}
2019-03-14 15:09:27,901 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-8] [xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller] handleMacroExecutionException Error rendering macro: viewdoc
 -- url: /display/TT/test | page: 1998878 | traceId: b1461380347c5209 | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8090/pages/editpage.action?pageId=19
98878 | action: viewpage
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
{code}
h3. Notes
 * Increasing the available memory the max allowed by the environment still causes the issue.
 * The problem is not encountered if a normal chart is used in the word document.
 * The problem word docs fairly small in size. Example of a doc that causes the issue:
 ** [^Word-Doc-Problematic.docx]

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Word Doc w/ Embeded Excel Chart Causes Memory Issues

fields.description:
Currently, only watchers of a specific topic will be notified when a question is asked regarding that topic. Some admins may be keen to receive all notifications, even if they are not necessarily watchers for a given topic. 

Some organizations could benefit from having a larger, configurable notification scheme to help drive adoption of Confluence Questions. Some examples would be:
* reminder notifications to admins when questions haven't been answered (configurable threshold from time of creation) 
* questions with answers and no accepted answer (configurable threshold)
fields.summary: Expand Notifications Capability for Confluence Questions

fields.description:
Currently Confluence Questions doesn't have any reporting capabilities. Some admins would be keen to see metrics like the following:

* Time to first response
* Answer Rate
* Average time to answer
* Most popular tags
* Highest contributing users
fields.summary: Expand Reporting Capability in Confluence Questions

fields.description:
h5. Problem Description
Current quick search is excluding comments by default unless specifically selected from the content type. This is per design as outlined in  [Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/search-139528.html] page

h5. Proposed Behavior
A better behaviour would be if
* Comments are included by default into the quick search content type and can be unticked if the search is customised
* Quick search defaults for all users can be modified from admin panel depending on the business case
fields.summary: Include Comments into quick search by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Starting with Confluence 6.14, redirecting from quick Search to Advanced search via advanced search link, defaults to Custom Type instead of All content as it was prior to 6.14
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.14.* with new Quick Search

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment on a page
 # Search for the same comment in quick search
 # Comment is not found as comments are excluded from default quick search as per statement in [Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/search-139528.html] page.
 # Click Advanced Search to be redirected to Advanced Search

h3. Expected Results
 * Comment is found as Advanced search searched *All Content* types by default

h3. Actual Results
 * Comment is not found as Advanced Search switches to the *Custom* content type search that includes only Space, User, Page, Blog post and Attachment
 !quicksearch1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 * Including Comments into Quick Search type, will include them into Advanced Search custom type search field
 * Clicking Advanced Search link without typing anything into the search field will default to All Content in Advanced Search

h3. Resolution

Upgrade to Confluence 6.15.1 or above
fields.summary: Advanced Search defaults to custom type search if any content was searched prior to redirect

Due to a [security advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-security-advisory-2019-03-20-966660264.html] it is required to disable WebDAV add-on in case if the instance cannot be upgraded. During the disabling, the Office Connector add-on will also be disabled (viewxls macro will not work) as this is linked requirement of WebDAV add-on. It is a good practice for users to change their passwords, especially passwords that are manually created for them by Confluence admins. Being notified of this, would encourage more users to change their passwords.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

There are 2 types of create buttons in Confluence: Quick create (to create a page) and Blueprint create (will bring up a Create dialog with blueprint options). In order to decide if these buttons should be visible or not, for every page load, Confluence has to execute several DB queries to scan all _SPACES_ and SPACEPERMISSIONS tables to find any spaces in which current user has permission to create page/blogpost. You can find a sample query below:
{code:java}
SELECT DISTINCT
    space1_.SPACEID       AS SPACEID1_59_,
    space1_.SPACENAME     AS SPACENAM2_59_,
    space1_.SPACEKEY      AS SPACEKEY3_59_,
    space1_.LOWERSPACEKEY AS LOWERSPA4_59_,
    space1_.SPACEDESCID   AS SPACEDES5_59_,
    space1_.HOMEPAGE      AS HOMEPAGE6_59_,
    space1_.CREATOR       AS CREATOR7_59_,
    space1_.CREATIONDATE  AS CREATION8_59_,
    space1_.LASTMODIFIER  AS LASTMODI9_59_,
    space1_.LASTMODDATE   AS LASTMOD10_59_,
    space1_.SPACETYPE     AS SPACETY11_59_,
    space1_.SPACESTATUS   AS SPACEST12_59_
FROM
    SPACEPERMISSIONS spacepermi0_
INNER JOIN
    SPACES space1_
ON
    spacepermi0_.SPACEID=space1_.SPACEID
WHERE
    (
        spacepermi0_.PERMUSERNAME='user-key-1'
    OR  spacepermi0_.PERMGROUPNAME IN ('group-1' ,
                                       'group-2' ,
                                       'group-3' ,
                                       'group-4')
    OR  spacepermi0_.PERMALLUSERSSUBJECT='authenticated-users'
    OR  (
            spacepermi0_.PERMUSERNAME IS NULL)
    AND (
            spacepermi0_.PERMGROUPNAME IS NULL)
    AND (
            spacepermi0_.PERMALLUSERSSUBJECT IS NULL))
AND spacepermi0_.PERMTYPE='EDITSPACE'
AND (
        space1_.SPACESTATUS IN ('CURRENT'))
ORDER BY
    space1_.SPACENAME,
    space1_.SPACEKEY limit 1
{code}
These permission queries don't scale well, especially in MySQL. Below you can find average query time for a dataset of about 6,000 spaces and 300,000 records in SPACEPERMISSIONS table:
||DBMS||Avg query time (ms)||
|Postgres|40|
|{color:#ff0000}MySQL{color}|{color:#ff0000}300{color}|
|SQL Server|20|
|Oracle|50|

Not only expensive, the number of these queries is also unnecessary high. See below for count for each page type and type of Create buttons:
|| ||Dashboard||Page/Blogpost View||
|*Quick Create*|2|0|
|*Blueprint Create*|2|2|

Under very high load, these queries can put enormous pressure on DB and may even cause outages.
h3. Root cause

The code to render Create buttons doesn't scale well because it involves too many queries which can be costly in big instances. This ticket aims to alleviate some problems in CONFSERVER-57535 while the proper fix is being considered.

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Reduce number and cost of permission queries to render create buttons

Team Calendars for Confluence while being installed both from the [Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/72307/team-calendars-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] and from Confluence installer are showing as incompatible with Confluence 6.15.x

Team Calendars 6.0.27

h3. Expected Results
Team Calendars showing as compatible and available.


h3. Actual Results
Team Calendars out of the box are showing as incompatible

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary Editing the Confluence login screen to display a custom message (such as directions on account creation) as described in the [Modify Confluence Interface Text KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/modify-confluence-interface-text-964961242.html] will not show any of the expected changes. This impacts all browsers/operating systems h3. Steps to Reproduce # Following the [Modify Confluence Interface Text KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/modify-confluence-interface-text-964961242.html], extract the ConfluenceActionSupport.properties file. # Find the 'login.name=' field and enter any kind of text or HTML # Repackage the jar and restart Confluence per the KB *OR* From the language selection links on the log in screen, switch between English (UK) and English (US) h3. Expected Results Instead of the default log in title message, you should see the custom text entered in 'login.name='. !Custom_Working.png|thumbnail! h3. Actual Results No changes are made to the login screen and the default 'Log in' title is displayed !Custom_Not_Working.png|thumbnail! h3. Workaround Change the default browser language to en_GB. The issue is confirmed to affect browsers using en_US as the default language. Steps in Chrome: # Got to Chrome settings # Down down the Advanced menu # Expand 'Languages' and either move English (US) down or add English (GB) as the default (top of the list) *OR* Select English(UK) at the login screen *OR* [Edit the login.vm file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/customizing-the-login-page-163938553.html], line 58, add required text between {{

$action.getText('}} and {{')

}}
fields.summary: Modified Confluence Interface Text Is Not Rendered

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you set a System field in Jira as required and the field is not a text field, text area, URL or number (for example), it won't show up as mandatory in Confluence when you try to create it (using the highlight functionality or creating through Jira Issue macro).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Jira, click on the cog icon and go to *Issue >> Field configurations*
 # Click on the *Configure* link
 # Make a date/drop-down field required (for example, the Priority or Due Date fields) by clicking on the *Required* option next to it
 # Go to a Confluence page and highlight some words to create a Jira Issue from there

h3. Expected Results
 * All the mandatory fields are shown in the pop-up box that appears

h3. Actual Results
 * Even though the Jira fields were set as required in Jira, they don't show up as mandatory in Confluence when you try to create a Jira Issue from there.

h3. Notes
 * This issue was replicable with date and drop-down fields.

h3. Workaround

None yet.
fields.summary: Some Jira's System fields which are required are not showing up in Confluence

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary

Our [Cache Performance Tuning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/cache-performance-tuning-169119133.html] page, currently states the following:
{quote}It is essential for the administrator of a large production installation of Confluence to size the caches to suit its environment.
{quote}
This can lead Administrators into tuning cache performance for cache performance's sake, without measuring what effect this has on customers/page loads. Thus we have no idea how effective the changes are, and much more importantly, if they are needed.
h2. Request

We've made the following addition to the page, just so we can better inform our customers.
{quote}(i) While this is an important task, having a comparison point is essential to help identify how effective the changes are, and much more importantly, if they are needed. (e.g. Comparing page load time, login time, etc.).
{quote}
We'd like to have the changes made for all current and future versions of the page.
fields.summary: Changes for Cache Performance Tuning page

fields.description:

When a user subscribed the team calendar via CalDav in Andriod and edited a recursive event in Confluence team calendar, the event will be synced to the Andriod calendar and appear twice.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

TimSort throws "Comparison method violates its general contract!" error using NaturalStringComparator. 

h3. Environment
This was confirmed by unit testing against a source code of 6.14.2.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Add a following testing method against test class for {{NaturalStringComparator}} 
{code:java}
    @Test
    public void testContractViolationError() {
        final List<String> list = Arrays.asList(
                "a",
                "a",
                "亜",
                "a",
                "a",
                "a",
                "a",
                "a",
                "a",
                "a",
                "1",
                "a",
                "a",
                "1",
                "1",
                "a",
                "a",
                "a",
                "亜",
                "1",
                "a",
                "亜",
                "a",
                "亜",
                "10",
                "５",
                "５",
                "a",
                "あ",
                "亜",
                "a",
                "a",
                "亜",
                "a",
                "a",
                "a",
                "1",
                "1",
                "1",
                "a",
                "a",
                "1",
                "a",
                "1",
                "a",
                "亜"
        );
        try {
            list.sort(comparator);
        }catch(Exception e)
        {
            e.printStackTrace();
            Assert.fail();
        }
    }
{code}

h3. Expected Results
No exception raised and sorted correctly.

h3. Actual Results

Test fails with following Exception.
{code:none}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Comparison method violates its general contract!
	at java.util.TimSort.mergeLo(TimSort.java:777)
	at java.util.TimSort.mergeAt(TimSort.java:514)
	at java.util.TimSort.mergeCollapse(TimSort.java:441)
	at java.util.TimSort.sort(TimSort.java:245)
	at java.util.Arrays.sort(Arrays.java:1438)
	at java.util.Arrays$ArrayList.sort(Arrays.java:3895)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.TestNaturalStringComparator.testContractViolationError(TestNaturalStringComparator.java:275)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod$1.runReflectiveCall(FrameworkMethod.java:50)
	at org.junit.internal.runners.model.ReflectiveCallable.run(ReflectiveCallable.java:12)
	at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod.invokeExplosively(FrameworkMethod.java:47)
	at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.InvokeMethod.evaluate(InvokeMethod.java:17)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.runLeaf(ParentRunner.java:325)
	at org.junit.runners.BlockJUnit4ClassRunner.runChild(BlockJUnit4ClassRunner.java:78)
	at org.junit.runners.BlockJUnit4ClassRunner.runChild(BlockJUnit4ClassRunner.java:57)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner$3.run(ParentRunner.java:290)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner$1.schedule(ParentRunner.java:71)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.runChildren(ParentRunner.java:288)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.access$000(ParentRunner.java:58)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner$2.evaluate(ParentRunner.java:268)
	at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.RunBefores.evaluate(RunBefores.java:26)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.run(ParentRunner.java:363)
	at org.junit.runner.JUnitCore.run(JUnitCore.java:137)
	at com.intellij.junit4.JUnit4IdeaTestRunner.startRunnerWithArgs(JUnit4IdeaTestRunner.java:68)
	at com.intellij.rt.execution.junit.IdeaTestRunner$Repeater.startRunnerWithArgs(IdeaTestRunner.java:47)
	at com.intellij.rt.execution.junit.JUnitStarter.prepareStreamsAndStart(JUnitStarter.java:242)
	at com.intellij.rt.execution.junit.JUnitStarter.main(JUnitStarter.java:70)

{code}

h3. Notes
This was confirmed by unit testing in my end, however a customer faced this error in page tree sorting.

h3. Workaround

Adding this JVM system property fixes the issue:
-Djava.util.Arrays.useLegacyMergeSort=true
fields.summary: NaturalStringComparator causes "Comparison method violates its general contract!" when specific order of strings given

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There is no more option to apply fixed width setting to tables on exported PDF.
It was actually supported in Confluence 6.2.1 ~ Confluence 6.13.0.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a wide table with *fixed-width* setting on a page
# Export the page as PDF

h3. Expected Results

# If *fixed-width* setting is applied to the table, the table should be shown with fixed width on the exported PDF
#- If the table is potentially wider than the PDF width, *it can't be helped that the table is cut-off on the exported PDF*
# If *responsive* setting is applied to the table, the table should be shown responsively on the exported PDF
#- Even if the table is potentially wider than the PDF width, the table should be shown without cut-off on the exported PDF

h3. Actual Results

The table is always shown responsively regardless of responsive / fixed-width setting.
 
h3. History of table column width problems
# Before Confluence 5.10.x
#- Due to CONFSERVER-34390, users have *no option at all* to export long tables without cut-off
# Confluence 5.10.x ~ Confluence 6.2.1
#- Thanks to [Confluence 5.10.x release|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-5-10-release-notes-826894762.html#Confluence5.10ReleaseNotes-Takecontrolofyourtables], Confluence started to have an option to set responsive width to tables
(i) Actually, these versions of Confluence had worked as described in *Expected Results* section in this bug report.
# Confluence 6.2.1 ~ Confluence 6.13.0
#- Due to CONFSERVER-54275, all the table columns are shown with the same width regardless of responsive / fixed-width setting
# After Confluence 6.13.0
#- Tables are always shown responsively regardless of responsive / fixed-width setting ← Now!

h3.Workaround

There is no workaround so far.
fields.summary: No more option to apply fixed width setting to tables on exported PDF

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* When importing a Word document in Confluence, if Collaborative Editing is on Limited mode, the document won't be imported and will throw the following error message:
{code}
com.atlassian.confluence.internal.synchrony.ExternalChangesException: Unable to save changes made outside the editor to ContentId{id=65611} while collaborative editing is disabled.
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.handleContentUpdateBeforeSave(DefaultPageManager.java:1499)
{code} 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Access your Confluence's *General Configuration >> Collaborative Editing*
# Click on the *Change mode* button
# Select the *Limited* option and click on the *Save* button
# On a Confluence page, click on *... >> Import Word Document*
# Click on *Choose File* and browse for the file you wish to import
# Click on the *Next* button
# Leave the import options in the default settings
# Click on the *Import* button

h3. Expected Results  

* The Word document is imported on Confluence, or, in case this is an expected limitation, the error thrown is shown in a more user-friendly way.
